channel.title: Dave's linkblog feed
channel.description: My linkblog has been around in various locations for many years.

item.description: The reason I‚Äôm having so much fun with this mofo is that I have most of the features of textcasting now, and it‚Äôs all flowing out through Masto, and I‚Äôm not typing into a freaking tiny little text box!
item.source:markdown: The reason I‚Äôm having so much fun with this mofo is that I have most of the features of textcasting now, and it‚Äôs all flowing out through Masto, and I‚Äôm not typing into a freaking tiny little text box!

item.description: Why does American television and press ‚Äúboth-sides‚Äù our politics? Why are such different presidential candidates presented as equally flawed? Why do the outrages of Trump, for example at the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee, lead to the humiliation of Biden?
item.source:markdown: Why does American television and press ‚Äúboth-sides‚Äù our politics? Why are such different presidential candidates presented as equally flawed? Why do the outrages of Trump, for example at the Republican National Convention in Milwaukee, lead to the humiliation of Biden?

item.description: The web I want vs the one we have. (My second day of blogging in Mastodon via WordPress, and I like it even more than I did yesterday.)
item.source:markdown: The web I want vs the one we have. (My second day of blogging in Mastodon via WordPress, and I like it even more than I did yesterday.)

item.description: Trump's top general calls former president "fascist" and "dangerous" threat. (Not exactly news, but it‚Äôs nice to see one pub report it, even if it is just a quote.)
item.source:markdown: Trump's top general calls former president "fascist" and "dangerous" threat. (Not exactly news, but it‚Äôs nice to see one pub report it, even if it is just a quote.)

item.description: Scripting News: The web lives in WordPress and Mastodon. I am more excited about the web than I have been in a long time.
item.source:markdown: Scripting News: The web lives in WordPress and Mastodon. I am more excited about the web than I have been in a long time.

item.description: Gay Grimace Mets Better Win on Pride Night.
item.source:markdown: Gay Grimace Mets Better Win on Pride Night.

item.description: The Regime is a shitty HBO series, but I like it anyway. Sometimes crud is fun. And of course Kate Winslet is a treat.
item.source:markdown: The Regime is a shitty HBO series, but I like it anyway. Sometimes crud is fun. And of course Kate Winslet is a treat.

item.description: I've decided to start using my wordpress/mastodon site to do some real blogging. It's good because I can write for it anywhere there's a web browser, unlike my main blog which these days is pretty much tied into my desktop system.
item.source:markdown: I've decided to start using my wordpress/mastodon site to do some real blogging. It's good because I can write for it anywhere there's a web browser, unlike my main blog which these days is pretty much tied into my desktop system.

item.description: ‚ÄúA young woman looking ahead to her future doesn‚Äôt have to be brainwashed to decide that she wants the right to decide when and whether to have a child.‚Äù
item.source:markdown: ‚ÄúA young woman looking ahead to her future doesn‚Äôt have to be brainwashed to decide that she wants the right to decide when and whether to have a child.‚Äù

item.description: I would switch to any podcatcher that let me edit my subscription list outside their app, because I use that list in different contexts, also because I‚Äôd like to share my list with others, also because there are lots of others, aka influencers who‚Äôd like to too. You‚Äôd own the market if you did this.
item.source:markdown: I would switch to any podcatcher that let me edit my subscription list outside their app, because I use that list in different contexts, also because I‚Äôd like to share my list with others, also because there are lots of others, aka influencers who‚Äôd like to too. You‚Äôd own the market if you did this.

item.description: Cynicism isn‚Äôt always the right explanation. Sometimes people just want to share something good with you, that doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean they‚Äôre stupid, maybe they just like you. üòÄ
item.source:markdown: Cynicism isn‚Äôt always the right explanation. Sometimes people just want to share something good with you, that doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean they‚Äôre stupid, maybe they just like you. üòÄ

item.description: How the fediverse could work. 1. Copy the URL of a post from one site. 2. Paste it into a post on another site. That's how you open a wormhole into another universe.
item.source:markdown: How the fediverse could work. 1\. Copy the URL of a post from one site. 2\. Paste it into a post on another site. That's how you open a wormhole into another universe.

item.description: Obama in 2009 had a chance: ‚ÄúPeople around the campaign were BEGGING him to keep the movement infrastructure alive and he scuttled it for a strategy of glazing of the biggest shitstains in the world.‚Äù Obama went for the money, not the people, and we lost.

item.description: Yesterday I briefly wrote up the mass market killer app for AI. I know this is it. Ten years from now people will think everyone always knew it. Before you click the link pause for a moment and think about it. Hint: Google should totally own this but they have a blind spot.
item.source:markdown: Yesterday I briefly wrote up the mass market killer app for AI. I know this is it. Ten years from now people will think everyone always knew it. Before you click the link pause for a moment and think about it. Hint: Google should totally own this but they have a blind spot.

item.description: Canvas is a new way to write and code with ChatGPT. I just got access to this. I think I'm going to spend the rest of the day trying it out on a coding project. I have a problem I need to iterate over with ChatGPT and that has been in general a frustrating process, iterating.
item.source:markdown: Canvas is a new way to write and code with ChatGPT. I just got access to this. I think I'm going to spend the rest of the day trying it out on a coding project. I have a problem I need to iterate over with ChatGPT and that has been in general a frustrating process, iterating.

item.description: A test of writing in WordPress, published to Mastodon. This WordPress post is part of the Fediverse. Click on the link to see the same story on mastodon.social. A new kind of interop.

item.description: I was able to write a post that appeared on Mastodon using ActivityPub. All via the WordPress API. Congrats to the ActivtyPub community, Automattic and Mastodon. "It just worked." 9 minute podcast.
item.source:markdown: I was able to write a post that appeared on Mastodon using ActivityPub. All via the WordPress API. Congrats to the ActivtyPub community, Automattic and Mastodon. "It just worked." 9 minute podcast.

item.description: It appears the first Grateful Dead song in the RSS podcasting experiment in 2001 was (of course) Dark Star. Someone asked, so I looked it up.
item.source:markdown: It appears the first Grateful Dead song in the RSS podcasting experiment in 2001 was (of course) Dark Star. Someone asked, so I looked it up.

item.title: countdown
item.description: scripting.com turns thirty in: 21 minutes, 42 seconds. (Time for a nap.)
item.source:markdown: [scripting.com](http://scripting.com) turns thirty in: 21 minutes, 42 seconds. (Time for a nap.)

item.description: My WordPress home in the Fediverse. If you have a Mastodon account you should be able to follow me. Also with other ActivityPub clients, but so far I've only tested with Mastodon.
item.source:markdown: My WordPress home in the Fediverse. If you have a Mastodon account you should be able to follow me. Also with other ActivityPub clients, but so far I've only tested with Mastodon.

item.description: This is an item in my Mastodon timeline that I posted in WordPress via ActivityPub. I did nothing but turn the feature on in a dialog box. Since WordPress itself is highly scriptable, it now can act as an easy gateway to the Fediverse. The only thing they aren't doing that the others do is hyping it up (cough Ghost cough). üòÄ
item.source:markdown: This is an item in my Mastodon timeline that I posted in WordPress via ActivityPub. I did nothing but turn the feature on in a dialog box. Since WordPress itself is highly scriptable, it now can act as an *easy* gateway to the Fediverse. The only thing they aren't doing that the others do is hyping it up (cough Ghost cough). üòÄ

item.description: 1995: Eudora was a central piece of technology to the bootstrap of blogging. It's always like that, it starts out as an experiment to see what's possible, and in this case, a lot was possible. I don't know if it was open source, but it was brilliant and risky and made it all possible w/o going through gatekeepers.
item.source:markdown: 1995: Eudora was a central piece of technology to the bootstrap of blogging. It's always like that, it starts out as an experiment to see what's possible, and in this case, a lot was possible. I don't know if it was open source, but it was brilliant and risky and made it all possible w/o going through gatekeepers.

item.description: A comment from thirty years of blogging. "Blogging seems kind of lost, and I would like to see that change. Every time you post something you're proud of on a social media site, take a moment to post it to your blog. And, if appropriate, link to something in your blog post, even though the social media sites don't support linking, the web is still here and it still does."
item.source:markdown: A comment from thirty years of blogging. "Blogging seems kind of lost, and I would like to see that change. Every time you post something you're proud of on a social media site, take a moment to post it to your blog. And, if appropriate, link to something in your blog post, even though the social media sites don't support linking, the web is still here and it still does."

item.description: Andrew is a "persistent blogger" if not natural-born as some of us are. Thanks for the good wishes, and thanks for using a blog to send your greetings. :-)
item.source:markdown: Andrew is a "persistent blogger" if not natural-born as some of us are. Thanks for the good wishes, and thanks for using a blog to send your greetings. :-)

item.description: It's remarkable that Republican governors work with the Democratic president on disaster relief, but they won't sign up for Medicaid and such. A reporter should dig into why there's this difference.
item.source:markdown: It's remarkable that Republican governors work with the Democratic president on disaster relief, but they won't sign up for Medicaid and such. A reporter should dig into why there's this difference.
